BackstoryDef.title: Goa'uld servant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Born into the shadow of a self-proclaimed god, [PAWN_nameDef] spent their childhood groveling at the feet of glowing-eyed overlords. Polishing armor, fetching symbiote snacks, and learning never to make eye contact. A glamorous upbringing, really.

BackstoryDef.title: Temple Acolyte
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Raised in a pyramid temple deep in the jungle, [PAWN_nameDef] memorized endless chants, rituals, and the importance of never asking “who made the gods?”. They spent most of their youth polishing golden idols and translating "divine" gibberish.

BackstoryDef.title: Larval Host
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: From a young age, [PAWN_nameDef] was chosen to incubate larval symbiotes—a sacred and gooey duty. Most of their childhood was spent in medical labs, nutrient baths, and dealing with chronic stomach growls that weren’t entirely theirs.

BackstoryDef.title: temple archivist’s ward
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Raised in a pyramid’s dust-choked archives, [PAWN_nameDef] learned to copy “divine” decrees and catalogue tribute. The real lessons were in reading between lines—and ducking thrown scepters.

BackstoryDef.title: pyramid scullion
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Cookfires, spilled broth, and shouted orders—[PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a palace kitchen feeding armies and egos. They learned timing, poison-spotting, and the art of being invisible.

BackstoryDef.title: training-yard page
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Too small to fight, big enough to fetch. [PAWN_nameDef] hauled practice staves, reset targets, and watched Jaffa drills until every barked order lived in their bones.

BackstoryDef.title: Tok’ra infiltrator
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] walked the razor’s edge between gods and rebellion. Posing as a loyal servant of the Goa’uld, they passed secrets to the Tok’ra network by night. Their past is a tangle of false identities, whispered codes, and narrow escapes.

BackstoryDef.title: System Lord’s clerk
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Not all served the Goa’uld with a staff weapon. [PAWN_nameDef] managed supply chains, tribute tallies, and the divine calendar. Accidentally miscounting a shipment of Naquadah often meant a swift trip to the sarcophagus—if lucky.

BackstoryDef.title: Jaffa
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was bred for strength, loyalty, and dramatic entrances. As a Jaffa, they carried a larval symbiote and a massive chip on their shoulder. Service to the Goa’uld was mandatory; personal opinions were not.

BackstoryDef.title: Goa'uld slave
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Chained by fate and fashion, [PAWN_nameDef] served the Goa’uld as a nameless, faceless laborer. Forbidden from fighting, learning, or even dreaming too loudly. Their daily highlight? Not being vaporized.

BackstoryDef.title: Slave driver
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Armed with a cruel rod of anguish and crueler orders, [PAWN_nameDef] was tasked with keeping miners and laborers in line. Their life was measured in screams per hour, not hours per shift. They learned how to instill fear, not how to lift a pick.

BackstoryDef.title: Overseer’s lackey
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Not all who served the Goa’uld held a weapon. [PAWN_nameDef] carried whips, schedules, and buckets of water for the “real” enforcers. They became adept at surviving by standing just far enough behind authority.

BackstoryDef.title: Broken overseer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Once entrusted with enforcing the System Lord’s will, [PAWN_nameDef] eventually fell from grace—whether from pity, defiance, or sheer exhaustion. Branded and discarded, they drift between fear of punishment and memories of the screams they once commanded.

BackstoryDef.title: pyramid artificer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Idols don’t polish themselves. [PAWN_nameDef] gilded masks, etched Naquadah filigree, and repaired parade armor for officers who never said “thank you.” Their hands remember fine work—so does their back.

BackstoryDef.title: sarcophagus attendant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Night shifts in a whispering chamber. [PAWN_nameDef] kept a resurrection sarcophagus humming—monitoring crystal arrays, cleaning ichor, and ignoring who climbed in or crawled out.

BackstoryDef.title: pressed pit-fighter
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Entertainment for gods is expensive in blood. [PAWN_nameDef] fought in ritual arenas—wood against bronze, bronze against plasma. They survived by moving first and thinking last.

BackstoryDef.title: Naquadah smuggler
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Between tribute convoys and black-market caches, [PAWN_nameDef] learned routes the overseers didn’t know. Bribes, lies, and quick feet kept them alive—most days.

BackstoryDef.title: palace architect
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Vaults, kill-corridors, and glorious acoustics. [PAWN_nameDef] drafted strongholds to flatter egos and funnel rebels into crossfire. Their blueprints always included an escape route—personal habit.

BackstoryDef.title: tribute collector
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: With a ledger in one hand and armed escorts behind, [PAWN_nameDef] toured vassal worlds, squeezing grain, ore, and obedience from the fearful. They learned to spot lies and weigh silence.

BackstoryDef.title: penitent scribe
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: One wrong word about a god’s divinity earned [PAWN_nameDef] a lifetime copying confessions in a dungeon archive. They honed patience, neat handwriting, and a permanent flinch.

BackstoryDef.title: First Prime
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: As the First Prime of a System Lord, [PAWN_nameDef] served as enforcer, executioner, and occasional motivational speaker (with staff weapon). Feared by allies and enemies alike, they carried out divine will with zeal—and very little paperwork.

BackstoryDef.title: kara kesh adept
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Chosen to wield a kara kesh, [PAWN_nameDef] trained to turn thought into force—pinning, tossing, and crushing on command. The gods admired results, not restraint.
